suggestions: 4. Return or Destruction of Confidential Information. The Disclosing Party may elect at any time to terminate the Receiving Party’s further access to Confidential Information. At the request of the Disclosing Party or at such time as the Receiving Party decides not to pursue the potential Transaction, the Receiving Party will return or destroy all Confidential Information and shall cause its Representatives to do the same. The Receiving Party will certify such destruction in writing signed by an officer of the Receiving Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing and subject to the provisions of this Agreement, the Receiving Party may retain Confidential Information (a) as required to comply with bona fide legal or regulatory compliance obligations provided that such retained information is segregated and securely managed to prevent unauthorized access, and (b) in electronic format on system back-up tapes or other system back-up media according to industry-standard electronic back-up and archival procedures. Confidential Information so retained will remain subject to the terms of this Agreement notwithstanding its termination or expiration for a period of five (5) years.

9. Term. Except as otherwise expressly provided herein, this Agreement shall terminate and be of no further force and effect one (1) year from the date hereof, provided that in no case shall the Receiving Party be relieved from its responsibilities with respect to any breach of this Agreement prior to such termination. The confidentiality obligations set forth herein shall survive the termination or expiration of this Agreement for a period of five (5) years.
originalTexts: 4. Return or Destruction of Confidential Information. The Disclosing Party may elect at any time to terminate the Receiving Party’s further access to Confidential Information. At the request of the Disclosing Party or at such time as the Receiving Party decides not to pursue the potential Transaction, the Receiving Party will return or destroy all Confidential Information and shall cause its Representatives to do the same. The Receiving Party will certify such destruction in writing signed by an officer of the Receiving Party. Notwithstanding the foregoing and subject to the provisions of this Agreement, the Receiving Party may retain Confidential Information (a) as required to comply with bona fide legal or regulatory compliance obligations provided that such retained information is segregated and securely managed to prevent unauthorized access, and (b) in electronic format on system back-up tapes or other system back-up media according to industry-standard electronic back-up and archival procedures. Confidential Information so retained will remain subject to the terms of this Agreement notwithstanding its termination for so long as such material is retained.

9. Term. Except as otherwise expressly provided herein, this Agreement shall terminate and be of no further force and effect one (1) year from the date hereof, provided that in no case shall the Receiving Party be relieved from its responsibilities with respect to any breach of this Agreement prior to such termination.
